bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Gustaf E. Lambert, December 30, 1941

div1.p: Hench introduces himself to Lambert. He requests to meet with him during a stop-over in Chicago in order to ask him a few questions about the yellow fever experiments in Havana.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Gustaf E. Lambert, December 30, 1941
div1.opener:
Y F
December 30, 1941
Mr. Gust E. Lambert
4718 Woodlawn Avenue
Chicago, Illinois
My dear Mr. Lambert:
div1.p:
I have received your address from Mr. George
Kellogg of the Wyeth Company. I believe, therefore,
you have already received a copy of Cornwell's painting,
and the reprint of mine on the conquest of yellow fever.
I expect to go to Atlantic City and Washington the
second week in January. I cannot stop in Chicago on my
way there but expect to have a few hours in Chicago on my
return, about the third week in January. Would it be
possible for me to meet you and ask you a few questions about
the yellow fever episode in Havana and perhaps see any
souvenirs, newspaper clippings, photographs, etc. that you
might have.
I shall be indeed grateful for this courtesy.
div1.closer: Very sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
